questions.text: Breast magnetic resonance imaging (MRI)

options.label: A
options.text: Is a valuable screening tool among high-risk women (i.e., BRCA mutation carriers)

options.label: B
options.text: Has high specificity but low sensitivity

options.label: C

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: A. Is a valuable screening tool among high-risk women (i.e., BRCA mutation carriers)

questions.text: Which of the following is true regarding phyllodes tumor?

options.label: A
options.text: Present in older women when compared to fibroadenomas

questions.text: Criteria for consideration of genetic testing for hereditary breast cancer syndromes include

options.label: A
options.text: Personal history of breast cancer diagnosed at ?40 years old

options.label: B
options.text: Personal history of epithelial ovarian cancer at any age

options.label: C
options.text: Triple-negative breast cancer phenotype diagnosed at ?60 years old

questions.text: The gastroesophageal junction is located above the diaphragmatic hiatus in which type(s) of hiatal hernia?
questions.correct_answer: C. Types I, III, and IV

questions.text: A 59-year-old male with a several-month history of dysphagia is diagnosed with adenocarcinoma of the distal esophagus. An EUS shows the tumor to invade periesophageal tissue but not adjacent structures. CT scans of the chest and abdomen show no distant metastasis. The patient is otherwise healthy. Which of the following treatments provide the best chance for long-term survival?

Which of the following statements is most accurate concerning the three most commonly performed duodenal ulcer surgeries: parietal cell vagotomy, truncal vagotomy with pyloroplasty, and truncal vagotomy with antrectomy?

options.label: A
options.text: Parietal cell vagotomy has the lowest ulcer recurrence rate among the three.

options.label: B
options.text: Truncal vagotomy with antrectomy is technically the least demanding and is the quickest to perform in an emergency situation

options.label: C
options.text: Parietal cell vagotomy is associated with the lowest occurrence of postoperative dumping syndrome

options.label: D
options.text: All three procedures involve severing the celiac and hepatic divisions of the vagus nerves

questions.correct_answer: C. Parietal cell vagotomy is associated with the lowest occurrence of postoperative dumping syndrome

questions.text: You have just begun a staging laparoscopy on a 58-yearold Asian American man with biopsy-proven gastric adenocarcinoma. Previous endoscopy revealed a diffusely thickened area of mucosa about 4 cm in diameter without ulceration in the body of the stomach. Endoscopic ultrasound (EUS) revealed a thickened body wall and perigastric lymphadenopathy. The spleen, pancreas, and liver appear normal on CT. Which of the following is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Given the involvement of perigastric lymph nodes, splenectomy is indicated.

options.label: B
options.text: A D1 lymphadenectomy with 15 lymph nodes is considered adequate for nodal sampling

options.label: C
options.text: If curative gastric resection is intended, a 3-cm margin of microscopically tumor-free, normal tissue is adequate.

options.label: D
options.text: Extension into the gastrocolic and gastrohepatic ligaments constitutes T4 disease, and a palliative operation is indicated.

questions.correct_answer: B. A D1 lymphadenectomy with 15 lymph nodes is considered adequate for nodal sampling

questions.text: Which of the following factors is likely to prevent spontaneous fistula closure?

options.label: C
options.text: Fistula tract less than 2.5 cm in length

questions.text: Superior mesenteric artery (SMA) syndrome is associated with which of the following?
Which of the following regarding the etiology of intussusception in adults is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Intussusception is infrequently caused by benign small bowel tumors.

options.label: B
options.text: Reduction of intussusception in adults should not be attempted by air or contrast enema.

options.label: C
options.text: Intussusception does not occur episodically in Peutz-Jeghers–associated hamartomas.

options.label: D
options.text: Intussusception is frequently caused by primary malignant small bowel tumors.

questions.correct_answer: B. Reduction of intussusception in adults should not be attempted by air or contrast enema.

questions.text: Which of the following is true of malignant small bowel neoplasms?

options.label: A
options.text: Small bowel adenocarcinoma comprises greater than 30% of small bowel malignancies and rarely presents with metastatic disease

options.label: B
options.text: Small bowel GI stromal tumors (GISTs) comprise 20% of small bowel malignancies and spread hematogenously to the liver and lungs and by local invasion

options.label: C
options.text: Primary small bowel lymphomas rarely present with indolent symptoms

options.label: D
options.text: Patients with primary small bowel lymphomas frequently have constitutional symptoms at the time of presentation.

questions.correct_answer: B. Small bowel GI stromal tumors (GISTs) comprise 20% of small bowel malignancies and spread hematogenously to the liver and lungs and by local invasion

A patient is postoperative day 2 from a laparoscopic cholecystectomy and presents with RUQ pain, fever, and vomiting. Ultrasound is performed and shows a biloma. What is the best method of treatment?

options.label: A
options.text: Intravenous fluids, intravenous antibiotics, and bowel rest

What is the appropriate treatment for a cholangiocarcinoma of the hepatic bifurcation?

questions.correct_answer: D. Bile duct resection and hepaticojejunostomy plus partial hepatectomy

questions.text: Which of the following is a contraindication to hepatectomy?

options.label: A
options.text: Planned future liver remnant less than 40% of total liver volume

questions.text: Unexpected parenchymal bleeding during hepatic resection can be controlled by

options.label: A
options.text: Rapidly decreasing central venous pressure (CVP) with additional anesthesia

questions.text: Which of the following regarding treatment options for HCC is true?

options.label: A
options.text: CT-guided radio-frequency ablation is not effective for tumors in close proximity to major branches of the portal or hepatic veins.

options.label: B
options.text: Resection for HCC has a better oncologic outcome compared to radio-frequency ablation for lesions 2 cm or less in diameter

options.label: C
options.text: According to the Barcelona Clinic Liver Cancer algorithm, resection can be undertaken in patients with Child’s A and B cirrhosis only

options.label: D
options.text: A patient with one hepatoma 2 cm in diameter and another hepatoma 3.5 cm in diameter is within Milan criteria for liver transplantation

questions.correct_answer: A. CT-guided radio-frequency ablation is not effective for tumors in close proximity to major branches of the portal or hepatic veins.

questions.text: A 25-year-old man is shot in the left lateral chest. In the emergency department, his blood pressure is 120/90 mm Hg, pulse rate is 104 beats per minute (bpm), and respiration rate is 36 breaths per minute. Chest x-ray shows air and fluid in the left pleural cavity. Nasogastric aspiration reveals blood-stained fluid. What is the best step to rule out esophageal injury?
Which of the following statements is most accurate regarding pancreatic fistula following pancreatic surgery?

options.label: A
options.text: Randomized prospective studies using octreotide have conclusively shown it prevents pancreatic fistula

options.label: B
options.text: Postoperative pancreatic fistulas have been reported to occur in as many as 30% of patients.

options.label: C
options.text: Surgical sealants or glues to occlude pancreatic fistulas remain experimental.

questions.correct_answer: B. Postoperative pancreatic fistulas have been reported to occur in as many as 30% of patients.

questions.text: Splenectomy is performed primarily for palliation in all of the following except

You are asked to evaluate a 50-year-old kidney transplant patient hospitalized with recurrent sigmoid diverticulitis. After initial improvement, the patient’s condition deteriorated, requiring transfer to the intensive care unit, intubation, and pressors. White blood cell (WBC) count was 30,000. CT scan of the abdomen was obtained, demonstrating a unilocular heterogeneous fluid collection in the splenic parenchyma. The following considerations are true regarding the appropriate management of this patient except which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: This patient will likely require colectomy in conjunction with management of splenic disease.

options.label: B
options.text: Broad-spectrum antibiotics including an antifungal agent are mandatory.

options.label: C
options.text: This process is likely a complication of diverticulitis.

options.label: D
options.text: Immunosuppression was a key predisposing factor in development of this problem

questions.correct_answer: D. Immunosuppression was a key predisposing factor in development of this problem

questions.text: The most common clinical presentation in patients with obturator hernia is
